content:
Forge says it's thursday: https://forge.rust-lang.org/. But I think I remember hearing the beta branch actually happens a couple days earlier, is that true?

It matters for intra-doc links since we're coming in right at the edge of the beta cutoff: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/74430

Yes, usually beta branches on Tuesday. See https://forge.rust-lang.org/release/process.html.

But we really shouldn't ever be rushing stabilization of features - even though I completely understand the desire to do so :)

I mean, there's no reason not to stabilize. Intra doc links have been around for years and the major bugs were fixed 6 weeks ago. If other bugs pop up that's what the release train is for, there haven't been any sweeping changes since fixing async-std that make me think it needs a full 12 weeks.

I'm not saying that there's necessarily a reason to block it, but it has received a lot of work in the last 6 weeks - IMO, non minor work. I am only saying that we should not rush (if it stabilizes in time, seems good, if not, well, I'm against backporting for sure).
on the bright side this means the error reporting will be a lot better when it does stabilize: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75916, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75756
